fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
h4. When customer adds a bullet to a comment field, the bullet is automatically indented to the right. Customer wants to have the ability to add the bullet without indentation right in the first position of the paragraph.
h4. Example:

How it is currently:

This is a test
 * test 1
 * test 2
 * test 3

What user wants it to be:

This is a test
 • test 1
 • test 2
 • test 3

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Add a bullet list to a comment field.
h3. Expected Results

 

This is a test
 • test 1
 • test 2
 • test 3
h3. Actual Results

This is a test
 * test 1
 * test 2
 * test 3

The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Add ascii caracter which is similar to the bullet.
fields.summary: Add bullets to comment fields without indentation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Custom Batching notifications templates are not persisted after a Jira restart

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Follow the steps from [Customizing email content in Jira Server|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/customizing-email-content-in-jira-server-1027142312.html#:~:text=Retrieve%20the%20Velocity%20templates] to modify one of the batched notifications templates
# Trigger one notification to confirm the changes were applied to the notification template
# Restart Jira
# Trigger another batched notification

h3. Expected Results
The changes that were applied to the batching notifications template should be persisted after a Jira restart.

h3. Actual Results
As soon we restart Jira, the batching notifications templates are set back to the default template.

h3. Workaround
Upload the customized templates per [Customizing email content in Jira Server|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/customizing-email-content-in-jira-server-1027142312.html#:~:text=Retrieve%20the%20Velocity%20templates] after a Jira restart.
fields.summary: Custom Batching notifications templates are not persisted after a Jira restart

fields.description:
Hi,

We are using Jira Server v8.16.1.

I found there are 2 points that are unreasonable for the Jira Project:
 # The project leader cannot administer the project by default. It just works as the default issue assignee. Thus every time the project is created, we need to add the project lead to the Administrator role. This is very time-consuming and may be missed. 
*Could you make the project lead to be the project Administrator role once the project is created?*
 # Users cannot know which members in the Jira group. This causes the project administrator cannot to make sure the group has all the members. If the Jira system administrator didn't synchronize the members in the group then there may be someone missed for the project and cause project delay. Thus the project administrator might rather add the project members one by one than add the related group. 
*Could you please let the user know who the group members are?*

 

Users usually encounter these 2 points, both the 2 points are very important. Can you implement them? Thanks.
fields.summary: I found out there are 2 unreasonable points for the Jira project.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira system is currently using _*underscore.js*_ *1.9.1*. However, it is being affected due to [CVE-2021-23358|https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2021-23358]
 * _The package underscore from 1.13.0-0 and before 1.13.0-2_
 * _From 1.3.2 and before 1.12.1 are vulnerable to Arbitrary Code Injection via the template function, particularly when a variable property is passed as an argument as it is not sanitized._

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install Jira Software 8.17 or below;

h3. Expected Results

Have Jira using  _*underscore.js*_ 1.13.1 or higher.
h3. Actual Results

Jira is using _*underscore.js*_ 1.9.1
h3. Workaround

No workaround is available.
fields.summary: CVE-2021-23358 - Need to upgrade Underscore.js to 1.13.1 or higher

Dear Team,

The new UI for adding users to a Jira project is not helpful, as the e-mail address/user ID is no longer visible. It is really annoying when I have first to add a user to be able to see his e-mail address/username. When I have a common name I have more than one complete identical items to choose from. 

(Jira Software server v8.13.7)

Best regards

Tomasz Dziadosz

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In some situations, the Logged hours will display an incorrect value that does not match with the worklok entries for an issue.

The problem can be reproduced by performing rapid inserts of worklog entries to a Jira issue using the REST API. We can see that the worklog entries are all created successfully, however the "Logged" value does not match.

There are two places where worklog data is stored in the database:
 * On the *jiraissue* table there's the *timespent* column.
 * On the *worklog* table theres's the *timeworked* column.

The sum of all entries in the worklog table for a given issue must match with the timespent value in in the jiraissue table, but this does not happen all the times.

When a worklog is created, a new row is added on the worklog table. Then Jira performs an UPDATE on the jiraissue.timespent value by a SQL query similar to this:
{code:sql}
UPDATE public.jiraissue SET pkey='null', UPDATED='2021-05-10 18:02:48.447', TIMEESTIMATE='0', TIMESPENT='9999' WHERE ID='10008'"
{code}
When rapid worklog inserts are performed, Jira doesn't seem to handle this well, leaving both values mismatched.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Perform a multiple insert of worklog entires in a Jira issue in a short amount of time.

h3. Expected Results
 * Verify that all worklog entries are correct and present in the issue and the "Logged" hours is correct.

h3. Actual Results

The worklog entries are all correctly inserted in the worklog table, but the sum of all worklog entries does not match with the Logged value.
 !worklog-1.png|thumbnail! 
 

Example of query to get the sum of all worklog entries for a specific issue:
{code:sql}
SELECT SUM(timeworked)
FROM worklog
WHERE issueid = (SELECT id FROM jiraissue WHERE issuenum = 20 and project = (SELECT id FROM project WHERE pkey='SCRUM'));

44100
{code}
SQL query to check the timespent value for the same issue:
{code:sql}
SELECT timespent FROM jiraissue WHERE issuenum = 20 and project = (SELECT id FROM project WHERE pkey='SCRUM')

2040{code}
Check the values are mismatched: 44100 <> 2040.
h3. Workaround

Manually fix the timespent value in the jiraissue table manually via SQL update:
{code:sql}
UPDATE jiraissue
SET timespent = <value_in_seconds>
WHERE ID = <Issue_ID>
{code}
fields.summary: Logged hours can show incorrect value as compared with worklog entries

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In Jira 8.14 we added a security feature that made encrypted passwords more secure in how they are stored and handled, see more details [Password encryption|https://confluence.atlassian.com/crowd042/password-encryption-1055691019.html].

After enabling this feature, Jira may stall during very heavy application usage due to contention on the LocalCache by the {{CachedEncryptor.decrypt}} method.

Currently, CachedEncryptor.decrypt has a limit of 4 concurrent requests which may cause the bottleneck. Additionally, stored passwords are invalidated after 10 minutes which leads to an increased number of requests.

The stacktrace looks as follows:
{code:java}
sun.misc.Unsafe.park(Native Method)
 java.util.concurrent.locks.LockSupport.park(LockSupport.java:175)
 java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.parkAndCheckInterrupt(AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.java:836)
 java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.acquireQueued(AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.java:870)
 java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.acquire(AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.java:1199)
 java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantLock$NonfairSync.lock(ReentrantLock.java:209)
 java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantLock.lock(ReentrantLock.java:285)
 com.google.common.cache.LocalCache$Segment.compute(LocalCache.java:2194)
 com.google.common.cache.LocalCache.compute(LocalCache.java:4197)
 com.google.common.cache.LocalCache.computeIfAbsent(LocalCache.java:4204)
 com.atlassian.crowd.crypto.CachedEncryptor.decrypt(CachedEncryptor.java:63)
 com.atlassian.crowd.crypto.SaltingEncryptor.decrypt(SaltingEncryptor.java:33)
 com.atlassian.crowd.crypto.MissingKeyHandlingEncryptor.decrypt(MissingKeyHandlingEncryptor.java:31)
 com.atlassian.crowd.crypto.PrefixBasedSwitchableEncryptor.decrypt(PrefixBasedSwitchableEncryptor.java:60)
 com.atlassian.crowd.crypto.ClusterLockingEncryptor.decrypt(ClusterLockingEncryptor.java:32)
 com.atlassian.jira.crowd.embedded.encryptors.JiraEncryptor.decrypt(JiraEncryptor.java:40)
 com.atlassian.crowd.crypto.DirectoryPasswordsEncryptor$$Lambda$1376/1299619370.apply(Unknown Source)
 com.atlassian.crowd.crypto.DirectoryPasswordsEncryptor.lambda$transformPasswordAttributes$0(DirectoryPasswordsEncryptor.java:32)
 com.atlassian.crowd.crypto.DirectoryPasswordsEncryptor$$Lambda$1377/330450352.apply(Unknown Source)
 java.util.HashMap.replaceAll(HashMap.java:1305)
 com.atlassian.crowd.crypto.DirectoryPasswordsEncryptor.transformPasswordAttributes(DirectoryPasswordsEncryptor.java:31)
 com.atlassian.crowd.crypto.DirectoryPasswordsEncryptor.decryptPasswords(DirectoryPasswordsEncryptor.java:20)
 com.atlassian.crowd.crypto.EncryptingDirectoryDAO$$Lambda$1375/1648181244.apply(Unknown Source)
{code}

h3. Workaround
There are 2 workarounds available.
h4. Workaround 1
Increase the retention period for the caches to ~30 minutes.
# Stop Jira.
# Add the following system property: *-Dcrowd.encryption.cache.expire.minutes=30*
#* To verify where the property should be configured for your instance please refer to: [Setting properties and options on startup|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/setting-properties-and-options-on-startup-938847831.html]
# Start Jira

h4. Workaround 2
If workaround 1 is not sufficient enough to handle the {{CachedEncryptor.decrypt}} requests, a sysadmin may disable the feature.
 # Navigate to *System* → *General configuration* → *Advanced Settings* in the admin panel.
 # Find option *crowd.encryption.encryptor.default* and set it’s value to *DISABLED*.
fields.summary: Jira stalls due to contention on CachedEncryptor.decrypt
Reindexing API misbehaviour causing performance issues: reIndex(issue) reindexing related entities

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

- Some custom fields are automatically added when the user operates without administrator permission.
-- ex: "Flagged(フラグ付き)" field will be added in Jira when the user operates(flagging an issue in Scrum board, adding Sprint Health Gadget in dashboard, etc.)
- In the audit log in Jira, the record shows the non-administrator added that custom field. And the administrator will get "surprise".

h3. Suggested Solution

- Please improve the documentation about auto-generated custom fields without administrator permission user may create before the administrator get "surprise".

h3. Workaround

- Check the audit log when the custom field is added.
fields.summary: Improve the documentation about auto-generated custom fields without administrator permission

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Testing deployments of Jira on AArch64-based EC2 instances (c6g, t4g, etc) revealed a consistent failure to restore index snapshots when using SNAPPY format. In my testing, it did not matter if an x86_64 or AArch64 node _created_ the snapshot – snapshots created on either architecture could not be restored by an AArch64 node.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Deploy Jira cluster on AArch64 hardware (e.g., via AWS)
 # Attempt to restore index from SNAPPY snapshot (either manually pulled from another node, when automatically pushed to other cluster nodes after foreground reindex, or from daily snapshot)

h3. Expected Results

Jira should extract the snapshot and restore the index.
h3. Actual Results

Snapshot creation completes successfully (in this example, via manual snapshot copy request from another node):
{code:java}

fields.description:
*+Expected Result:+*

When a Dashboard is created and shared with users, they should have that particular one listed under their dashboard menu, without the necessity to search for it.

+*Actual Result:*+ 

*1.* To find the *shared Dashboard* the user has to go to the *Dashboards menu* -> *Manage Dashboards*.
*2.* Click Search
*3.* Click the Search button again
*4.* Look for the shared Dashboard in the list and then access it from there.

+*Possible Solution:*+ 

Kindly consider making it possible that if a dashboard is shared with any user then it should be listed under their dashboard icon at the top menu and not inside a search list.
fields.summary: Shared Dashboard should appears on users top menu
Epic Colour with white (blank) background

HTML tags, when setting a description for reporter field. h3. Steps to Reproduce # _JIRA ADMINISTRATION > Issues > Field configurations > Default Field Configuration > Configure_ # Find Reporter and Edit # Set Description as "reporter description" # Create a ticket, and check the description of Reporter. h3. fields.description:
At this moment in Jira, some of the Wiki markups are only available in the text mode.
For some customers, it would be interesting to have a more advanced menu on the Visual mode, rather than the current one.

e.g. Some customers want to be able to add/change the color of the panel on the visual mode since making it on the text mode can be quite a challenge.
fields.summary: Wiki Markup Visual Menu ("Advanced" Mode)

fields.description:
Currently, as per the current rest API configuration, we can only add one user at a time or in case of adding users to project role we can add a group but we would like to request for a functionality whereby it would be possible to add multiple users at a time under project role or a group using REST API: https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/REST/8.5.4

On passing a rest API command to add an array of users we get the ordinary code 200 responses which means the command is successful but on checking we see that users have not been added. 

(i) So the question is why do we get a command successful message instead of an error message even though it is not allowed to add multiple users at a time.

Screenshot to pass multiple user for a role using rest api below
fields.summary: Allow adding array of users to a group or project role

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Generation of the list of custom fields available to the user for use in JQL queries on instances with large amount of projects (>~7000) takes a long time to complete. That time grows linearly with the amount of projects in the system - and so does the associated performance impact.
At certain threshold, it can impact the overall system stability.

h3. Suggested Solution
 
Apart from upgrading to a fixed version, only a significant reduction in the number of projects can help.

h3. Workaround 
None
fields.summary: Apply custom field permission checks lazily

fields.description: When clicking on a board, the user is redirected to a quickfilter on this board. It's possible to remove the quick filter which temporarily solves the issue however, this only works until the session is terminated. It would be desirable to have the option of the board not redirecting to the quickfilter.
fields.summary: Board shouldn't redirect to the quickfilter

fields.description:
It would be very helpful if the organization drop-down menu on the customer portal will have larger items than now because if the organization name is longer than 250 characters, it will be cut off.

This is a big problem as it takes a long time for the user to select the right organization to share the case with.
fields.summary: Customer Portal - Organization drop-down menu width

fields.description:
As of now, "*Create a new issue or add a comment to an existing issue*" Mail Handler offers the option to catch the Email Address from the incoming mail and Process it accordingly.

It will be useful to have the below two additional features:
 # Ability to process a mail only when the subject line matches a regular expression. Example: Process the Mail only when Subject contains some specific keywords like Error, warning, etc.
 # Ability to map the Project/Issue type based on the captured keyword from the Subject line.
fields.summary: Add more flexibility in "Create a new issue or add a comment to an existing issue" Mail Handler configuration

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When the user copies from some text editors and pastes a table on an issue comment using google chrome, the table loses formatting.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a simple table with data.
 # Select and copy (right-clicking or keyboard shortcut).
 # Paste in a Jira comment (right-clicking or keyboard shortcut) on visual mode.

h3. Expected Results

The table should be pasted keeping the formatting.
h3. Actual Results

The pasted table loses its format on Google Chrome Browser, copying from notepad, TextEdit, or Sublime Text 3.

Using Firefox or copying from Pages or VsCode works as expected.
h3. Workaround
 * Use text mode instead of the visual mode.
 * Use Mozilla Firefox instead of Google Chrome.
 * Copy the file content from VsCode or Pages.
fields.summary: When the user copies from some text editors and pastes a table on an issue comment using google chrome, the table loses formatting.

fields.description:
The request is to have feature parity with Jira Cloud with regard to the API for Bulk Adding/Editing of Remote Links.

Customer is referencing this documentation for Cloud: https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/software/rest/api-group-remote-links/#api-remotelinks-1-0-bulk-post which we do not have similar functionality for on-premise.
fields.summary: Bulk Update Remote Links

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When trying to create a hyperlink from Lotus Notes on a issue, the URL field does not accept it as a valid URL link:

But Jira willing to accept Lotus Notes links as a hyperlink in many other fields, without causing errors, on the same given issue. Fields such as:
 * *Custom field of type URL*
 * *Custom field of type text*
 * *Using the linking feature of an issue*

Since this hyperlink works in many different fields, being rendering in some of them and another one doesnt. The inconsistency when comes about Lotus Notes creates confusion among Jira users that see themselves having to open tickets requesting why they cannot use the hyperlink in a manner when the same works in a different field.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # On an open issue, click on option More> Link:
 # Choose option "Web Link" and insert a Lotus Notes Hyperlink

h3. Expected Results

What should be expected to happen would be Lotus Notes reference becoming an accepted hyperlink.

h3. Actual Results

The result is Jira rejecting the Lotus Notes link with the error: *"Invalid 'URL'. Make sure you include the full URL (e.g. [http://www.google.com|http://www.google.com/])"*

h3. Workaround

Users can use a "dummy" URL and place Lotus Notes link at the link text section on Web Link page.
fields.summary: UI Inconsistencies on rendering Lotus Notes hyperlinks
Customfield Cache Management is sensitive to Administrator's Locale

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Collecting status category colours via API results in the old ADG colours being fetched.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Use {{StatusCategory.getColorName()}} to collect the status category color of any categories;
 # Display it in the UI

h3. Expected Results
The resulting color is matching the [specification in ADG|https://atlassian.design/foundations/color#semantic-color]

h3. Actual Results
The returned color is the old ADG definition, meaning it does not match the current design and status category colours used in Jira.

h3. Workaround
The workaround is to use the existing CSS classes instead of the API method for this purpose.
fields.summary: Collecting status category colours via API results in the old ADG colours being fetched.

fields.description:
h3. *Problem Definition:*

Since we have many users interacting on a same project, and sometimes on a same issue, having more than a couple of users interacting by the Issue comments can be tricky and mislead the communication process.
 Therefore, we would like to suggest these improvements as follows:

h3. *Suggested Solution:*

{color:#0000ff}*Improvements in Comment Section of an Issue for better traceability and better usage:*{color}
 * In an issue, we should be able to add In Line comments.
 * If there are multiple comments posted in an issue, we should be able to reply back to any one of the comments.
 * Currently the comments just keep getting added and travels to the bottom, we cannot address the comment made by other person.

{color:#0000ff}*Filtering Comments:*{color}
 When there are too many comments on an issue, we would like to have a mechanism to filter out based on:
 * person
 * date
 * keywords

 

(on) By structuring issue comments area in such a manner, it can speed up ideas exchanges and avoid communication downfails.
fields.summary: Issue Comments Experience Improvement

fields.description: Use case that is common but not supported is the ability to grant read only roles to clients of a business that do not take up a Confluence license. Many companies have information should only be privy to clients and not the general public.
fields.summary: Read only roles for outside clients

fields.description:
h4. Problem Definition
 * We have a Github Enterprise account and 2 organizations under it, and an admin account can access/administrate all repos.
 The question is, according to the guide, I don't know if I should "Register new application" in "Settings > Developer settings > OAuth Apps" in the organisation account or in the admin account. (You probably should enhance the guide I think)

[https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver0814/linking-a-bitbucket-or-github-repository-with-jira-1043893405.html]

h4. Suggested Solution

Please add these extra note to the section of "Generate a new token in GitHub or GitHub Enterprise"
(!)For Git Hub Enterprise setup,  the action to Register new application" in "Settings > Developer settings > OAuth Apps under the Organization account or admin account depends on the customer as which repos they want to give JIRA access too. For example if there are all within the organization, then just "Register new application under organization account. Or else if Admin account have access to all the repos that they want to link to Jira, then proceed to "Register new application under Admin account.
fields.summary: Update to the documentation related to GitHub and Integration

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary While creating a request type in a project with existing custom fields that are set to Required, if the html markup is disabled, the description of the custom field is shown between

tags in Request Type edit page. h3. Steps to Reproduce # Set html markup in field description to disabled # Create a service desk project # Create a new custom field with description # Set the new custom field to required in the field configuration of the new project # Create a new request type # Check the details of the Request Type in the Edit Fields view # Changing the html markup in field description does not change the value, html tags remain. h3. Expected Results Only the description should be shown in the UI without the html paragraph tags h3. Actual Results Text is shown like below {noformat}

Custom field description

{noformat} h3. Workaround Create the request types while html markup in field description is enabled.
fields.summary:
Creating a request type with required fields while html markup is disabled, adds "

" tags to Field Help field in Request Type edit view

fields.description:
Affected versions of Atlassian Jira Server and Data Center allow remote attackers to redirect users to a malicious URL via a reverse tabnapping vulnerability in the Project Shortcuts feature.

The affected versions are before version 8.5.15, from version 8.6.0 before 8.13.7, from version 8.14.0 before 8.17.1, and from version 8.18.0 before 8.18.1.

 

*Affected versions:*
 * version < 8.5.15
 * 8.6.0 ≤ version < 8.13.7
 * 8.14.0 ≤ version < 8.17.1
 * 8.18.0 ≤ version < 8.18.1

*Fixed versions:*
 * 8.5.15
 * 8.13.7
 * 8.17.1
 * 8.18.1
fields.summary: Reverse tabnapping via Project Shortcuts feature - CVE-2021-39112

fields.description:
Affected versions of Jira Server and Jira Data Center have a XSS vulnerability in the EditWorkflowScheme.jspa component which allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary HTML or JavaScript:

_*Affected versions:*_
 * version < 8.5.14
 * 8.6.0 ≤ version <  8.13.6
 * 8.14.0 ≤ version < 8.16.1

_*Fixed versions:*_
 * 8.5.14
 * 8.13.6
 * 8.16.1

This vulnerability is attributed to Matteo Sebasta.
fields.summary: XSS in Issue Type /editworkflowscheme.jspa - CVE 2021-26080

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-71802].
{panel}
h3. Issue Summary

When editing an Issue collector and selecting the *Custom* template, there is a list of custom fields that we can select from by checking the box next to it.

When we check the box the custom field is added to the *"Template preview"* as expected.

When saving the changes, the template preview consider the changes but the check-boxes next to the custom fields got back to the empty value.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new Issue Collector.
 # On Template section, select Custom.
 # Select one or a few custom fields and click Update.
 # Back to the Issue Collector page, click Edit on the newly created collector.

h3. Expected Results

The custom fields selected in step 3 are checked, indicating which custom fields are present in the form.
h3. Actual Results

All custom field checkboxes are *unchecked* but the custom fields are correctly added to the form.
 !Issue Collector Custom Fields.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Issue collector custom template checkbox for custom fields is broken

fields.description: Next-gen projects and their features, like the Roadmap, are only currently available in Jira Cloud. It'd be a welcome addition to Server and Data Center distributions.
fields.summary: clone

fields.description:
Some of the filters that I create for work can get pretty lengthy.

It would be _super_ useful to have color-coding to help keep track of where each query starts and ends, similar to writing formulas in Excel.

Excel example:

!https://www.spreadsheetweb.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/Color-coded-paranthesis-in-complex-formulas-02.png!

 

An example query I've used for work:
{quote}issueFunction in portfolioChildrenOf("Team = 90") AND ((issueFunction in portfolioChildrenOf("Key in (DAF-1348, DAF-2685, DAF-19951, DAF-4807, DAF-8063, DAF-11468, DAF-1959)") OR Key in (DAF-2891)) AND type in (Task, "Master Task") OR labels = Daf_test) AND resolution is EMPTY AND NOT (issueFunction in portfolioChildrenOf("Key in (DAF-12540, DAF-23431)") OR key in (DAF-11475, DAF-11476)) AND summary !~ "16-Design"
{quote}
It'd be easier to read and troubleshoot if color-coded:
{quote}issueFunction in portfolioChildrenOf*{color:#de350b}({color}*"Team = 90"*{color:#de350b}){color}* AND *{color:#de350b}({color}{color:#4c9aff}({color}*issueFunction in portfolioChildrenOf*{color:#57d9a3}({color}*"Key in *{color:#ffab00}({color}*DAF-1348, DAF-2685, DAF-19951, DAF-4807, DAF-8063, DAF-11468, DAF-1959{color:#ffab00}*)*{color}"*{color:#57d9a3}){color}* OR Key in *{color:#57d9a3}({color}*DAF-2891{color:#57d9a3}*)*{color}{color:#4c9aff}*)*{color} AND type in {color:#4c9aff}*(*{color}Task, "Master Task"{color:#4c9aff}*)*{color} OR labels = Daf_test*{color:#de350b}){color}* AND resolution is EMPTY AND NOT *{color:#de350b}({color}*issueFunction in portfolioChildrenOf{color:#4c9aff}*(*{color}"Key in *{color:#57d9a3}({color}*DAF-12540, DAF-23431{color:#57d9a3}*)*{color}"*{color:#4c9aff}){color}* OR key in *{color:#4c9aff}({color}*DAF-11475, DAF-11476*{color:#4c9aff}){color}{color:#de350b}){color}* AND summary !~ "16-Design"
{quote}
fields.summary: Color-coded parentheses in Advanced Search JQL

fields.description:
As a Project Admin, I'd like to know if users with access to the Project are actually using it or not, so I can revoke their access from he Project.

Currently, the Users and roles page only shows the users' last session creation time. See [JRASERVER-72427|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-72427] for an issue report on that.
That info may not be relevant as the user may be active in _other Projects_ but not on the one reported. We need a more context-meaningful information.
fields.summary: Allow Project Admins to assess if the project users are actually using the Project

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The "Last Session" column on a Project's "Users and roles" shows the time the most recent sessions was *created*.
This is misleading as a session might've been created days ago but the user's been active recently.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access a Project's Users and roles page and compare the "Last session" to the users' most recent activities in Global Admin's User sessions.

h3. Expected Results
Th Project Admin would have a precise info on active users.
Perhaps the User session "Last Acessed" is more adequate.

h3. Actual Results
If the Session timeout's high, the Project Admin won't have a precise view into user's recent activity.

h3. Workaround
None. Only Jira Admins can access the User sessions and view the "Last Accessed" date.
fields.summary: The Last Session column in the Project Users and roles page is misleading

fields.description:
As a Jira Admin, I'd like to have a report on users activities to assess if they're making use of Jira licenses or not, for the purpose of unlicensing inactive users.

The report could be similar to what's described in [How to audit license usage and user activity in Jira|https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=1005789475]:
* Last login
* Last time a Dashboard was viewed
* Last time a Board was viewed
* Last time an issue search was performed
* Last time an issue was browsed (viewed)
* Last time an issue was created
* Last time an issue was transitioned
* Last time an issue was commented
* Last time an issue was assigned to the user
fields.summary: Provide Jira Admins user activity information for license administration and audit purposes

fields.description:
When using the End User CSV Import ("Issues" > "Import Issues from CSV"), we can specify the project in "Setup" phase(Project).
 !jira-project-choose-project.png|thumbnail!

And if "Map field value" is enabled in "Issue Type(Jira field)", we can map the value between CSV and expected values(Issue Type).
 !jira-project-csv-import-issue_type-mapping.png|thumbnail!

When the project chose, in Issue Type Scheme which restricts "Issue Type" in the project, target values can be restricted in "Map values" screen.
 !jira-project-types.png|thumbnail!
h3. Expected Results

When the project chose, Issue Types are restricted in Select box with the corresponding Issue Type Scheme.

example: Bug, Sub-task, サブタスク
h3. Actual results

All Issue Types are showed in Select box.

example: Bug, Epic, Story, Sub-task, Task, サブタスク, ストーリー, タスク, バグ
fields.summary: Issue Type can be restricted with Issue Type Scheme in Jira importers when the project specified

fields.description:
h3. Problem:
A plugin upgrade may have failed and the plugin remained enabled in an inconsistent status [JRASERVER-25871|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25871] or it may have failed to be enabled, after the upgrade, causing multiple issues for the users.

h3. Expected Behavior:
A notification for the administrator showing the lifecycle of the plugin upgrade (Upgrade start -> plugin disabled -> upgrade running -> upgrade finished -> plugin Enabled

h3. What do we see Instead:
No notifications received if the upgrade fails
Admin would need to open the log files and search for errors.
fields.summary: When a plugin upgrade fails, the administrator should be notified

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Considering a plugin that does have scheduled Jobs to be executed, when the plugin is under maintenance, the scheduled job should not be executed.


h3. Steps to Reproduce

 * plugin ScriptRunner upgrade started
{code}
2021-04-07 23:04:43,886-0700 ClusterMessageHandlerServiceThread:thread-1 INFO      [c.a.plugin.manager.DefaultPluginManager] Updating plugin 'com.onresolve.jira.groovy.groovyrunner' from version '6.22.0' to version '6.23.0'
{code}
* Scheduled task failed
{code}
2021-04-07 23:06:00,143-0700 Caesium-1-1 ERROR ServiceRunner [c.a.s.caesium.impl.SchedulerQueueWorker] Unhandled exception thrown by job QueuedJob[jobId=57a88c8a-b5c8-433d-b672-e840254e5096,deadline=1617861960000]
java.lang.Exception: Class com.onresolve.scriptrunner.canned.jira.jobs.JiraCustomScheduledJob could not be found, or could not be compiled
{code}

h3. Expected Results
* Scheduled job should not be executed while the plugin is being upgraded

h3. Actual Results
* Scheduled job was executed while the plugin was being upgraded
* Plugin was not enabled after the upgrade had finished

h3. Workaround
Manually check for scheduled jobs related to the plugin and [reschedule|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/scheduled-jobs-96567525.html] the job before starting the plugin upgrade.
fields.summary: When a plugin upgrade starts, scheduled tasks from the plugin should not run

fields.description:
Setting properties in a Jira ServiceManagement workflow doesn't consider the customer portal user, just "Service Desk Customers" role, that doesn't contain the same number of users.

 

For example, it's possible to set:

jira.permission.assign.projectrole 10100

jira.permission.edit.projectrole 10100

jira.permission.transition.projectrole 10100

That will consider only the users explicity added on that role. But that role doesn't include every customer in the customer portal.

 

It would be great to have something like:

jira.permission.assign.customer

jira.permission.edit.customer

jira.permission.transition.customer
fields.summary: Status Properties for Jira ServiceManagement

fields.description:
When Jira Service Management is installed on top of Jira Core, running the *Plan your upgrade* tool in ⚙️ → Applications → _Plan your upgrade_ recommends upgrading with the {{atlassian-jira-core-x.x.x}} installer/archive and then updating Jira Service Management within the UI.

This is not a recommended best practice (when Software is not installed) since Jira Service Management includes Core functionality and can be upgraded directly with the installer/archive.

However, when Jira Software is installed the *Plan your upgrade* provides the proper best practices recommendation of upgrading Jira Software and then updating Jira Service Management within the UI.
fields.summary: Update the recommended upgrade path in "Plan your upgrade" for Jira Service Management

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Customer not being able to see some of the custom fields in their configured Dashboard.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create three new custom Fields.
 ** *Business Unit* _- type: Checkbox - 4 or more options_
 ** *Update Required* _- type: Checkbox - 4 or more options_
 ** *Location Engagement* _- type: Bundled Field ([App Dynamic Forms|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1210820/dynamic-forms-for-jira?hosting=server&tab=overview]) - 3 or more options._
 *** This App allows you to create custom fields *inside* of another custom field. Our customer used it to put 3 other checkbox Fields inside of one.
 # Create 3 issues and fill the custom fields created with all the possible options.
 # Create a new Filter Results Gadget.
 # Edit the Gadget to show the following fields:
 ** _Issue type - Key - Summary - Epic Link - Priority - Created - Assigne - Reporter - Due Date - Business Unit - Update Required - Location Engagement._
 # Go to the Dashboard in the System Dashboard.

h3. Expected Results

See the Ellipses in the column to expand and see all the values when the fields have multiple values.
h3. Actual Results

The Jira custom field (type checkbox) does not show the ellipses to expand all values when the gadget also has the custom field from 3rd party plugin (Dynamic Forms).
  
 More details in the video attached to this bug: [^Gadget not showing all values.mp4]
h3. Workaround

Zooming out of the screen will make the ellipses show and after being extended, the issue does not occur.
fields.summary: Gadget not showing ellipse to expand multiple values

fields.description:
When using the End User CSV Import ("Issues" > "Import Issues from CSV"), it seems the fields available are based on the create screen of the project. Recently, I had an end user who was trying to import based on issue type and could not. I tried as an end user and also could not. 
 
h3. Steps to reproduce
# Log into Jira, access a project that has "Create Permissions" for the user
# Verify the project does not have the "Issue Type" field on the create screen
# Navigate to *"Issues" > "Import Issues from CSV"*
# Attempt to import a csv with the following information:
{noformat}
Issue Type,Summary,Epic Name
Bug,Test Issue 1,
Task,Test Issue 2,
Task,Test Issue 3,
Epic,Test Issue 4,Test issue 4
{noformat}

h3. Expected Results
The "Issue Type" Field should appear as an option

h3. Actual results
The dropdown will be missing the "Issue Type" field. 
This prevents users from creating issues as the type of their choosing.

----
I think it would be really useful if the "Issue Type" field was always selectable on the end user CSV import. I can see the case where users should only be able to import whatever is on the create screen (even for system fields), but I do believe the "Issue Type" should be the one field that is exempt from this rule. 

Also, I think it would be very useful to update the documentation to include a note mentioning that end users "can only map fields that appear on the create screen".
fields.summary: End user CSV import cannot import different issue types if "Issue Type" field is not on the screen

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Today when you add an attachment to the description field of an issue, it is added to the attachment section and the user must select the desired attachment under the attachment icon. That may be confusing for some users, who expect their attachment to appear on the description field.

* Video: [https://share.getcloudapp.com/YEuRn16w]
 

h3. Suggested Solution

Make it so the attachment appears on the description field, leaving the option to delete it from the text.

 
h3. Why this is important
The way this works today can be counterintuitive to some users, leading to confusion.
fields.summary: Make attachments appear in the description field

fields.description: I need the sprint report to show the total count of issues
fields.summary: I need the sprint report to show the total count of issues

fields.description:
A new install of Jira fails to start due to missed tables.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

* Environment:
 MySql 8.0
 JDBC 22
 Jira 8.16.1 binary install

* Create a new database
*  grant permission to an already existent user
*  Run config.sh to configure jira_home location and configure JDBC connection
*  Test connection -> It will be successful
*  Start Jira

h3. What was expected
 Jira install and enter the setup mode

h3. What had happened instead
 Jira did not enter the setup mode and fail as the database is empty (can not find tables)

h3. Workaround
 * Delete all content of Jira home folder
 * Drop Database, create new user, create new DB, and grant access:
{code:java}
drop database jiradb816;
create user 'jira-816'@'localhost' IDENTIFIED BY 'jira-816';
CREATE DATABASE jiradb816 CHARACTER SET utf8mb4 COLLATE utf8mb4_bin;
GRANT SELECT,INSERT,UPDATE,DELETE,CREATE,DROP,REFERENCES,ALTER,INDEX on jiradb816.* TO 'jira-816'@'localhost';
flush privileges;
{code}
fields.summary: Reusing a mysql database user on a new database caused Jira startup to fail with table not found error

fields.description:
Multiple and different events are published during an issue clone operation and as these events will vary depending on the fields and functionality the cloned issue has.  Hence, making difficult to determine when an clone operation is completed.

\\
This request suggest to add an {{Issue Clone Finished}} event to be published once an issue clone operation is finished which would allow listeners to be notified at that specific point in time so other operation can be triggered and changes applied to the values in the cloned issue.
fields.summary: Add an Issue Clone Finished event

fields.description:
As a Jira user I (desperately) need the ability to revert to previous saved version of any kind (type) of Jira ticket, to save a lot of my very precious time.

Context: I created some test cases using xRay for Jira. Some other user changed, by mistake, the value of the field "Test Type" from "Manual" to "Generic" for many of my test cases. This actions has lead to deleting all the steps of all these test cases.

To restore the test cases created by me I can use the History for each affected test, but it will require a lot of time to do a routine/boring work.

This related article could help: [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-questions/How-to-revert-to-previous-saved-version-of-a-story/qaq-p/1249478b]

I would suggest to add a link or a button in each history record : "Revert to this version" or something like this.

Please implement this new feature request and your sales will increase significantly + you will have my eternal gratitude.

Regards,

Gruia Toma
fields.summary: Revert to previous saved version of a Jiira ticket

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When opened URL on JIRA UI like http://<baseurl>/browse/<issuekey1>http://<baseurl>/<issuekey2> has wrong resulting URL

http://<baseurl>/<issuekey2> is resulting on the Page

h3. Steps to Reproduce

example : http://localhost:8853/j853/browse/SCRUM1-25http://localhost:8853/j853/browse/SCRUM1-1
 # Observe that http://<baseurl>/<issuekey2> is on browser URL 

h3. Expected Results

h3. Actual Results

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

External system import (CSV) will not add a default value to the custom fields when left empty in the CSV file when updating the existing issues. 

Jira version tested : 8.5.3 and 7.13.5
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # create a custom field (single select)
 # assign a default value to the custom field
 # use the CSV file to import the issues _(settings -> system -> external system import)_ leave the empty value for custom field column in the CSV file 
 # _map the issue key, summary and custom field columns for importing_  

Observe the link [https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver085/importing-data-from-csv-981155358.html]. The section "Updating existing issues" mentions below
{quote}
(warning) Importing a CSV to update existing issues will reset columns to their default values if they are not specified in the CSV.
{quote}

h3. Expected Results

The default value of the custom field on the issue ticket has to be updated as per the documentation link
h3. Actual Results

The existing value of the custom field on the issue ticket continues. 

No error is thrown
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: external system import does-not add default value to custom field when empty

fields.description:
It would be beneficial to have a JQL function for date fields, specifically, for Target Start and Target End that would aim to gather results of the entire day for example a function named today().

Target Start = today()
Target End = today()
fields.summary: Add JQL Function today()

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If we add a version number in the text field and if that version number have similar characters as in your issue key, On adding this version number with some test, the part of the version number that looks similar to the issue key gets converted to a hyperlink
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # create a project named "CMT" and create a issue with issue key "CMT-2"
 # create another project named "WDW"
 # now go to project settings for WDW>version>add the version number as CMT-2.34.7 and ZMS-3.2.5
 # create a new issue under WDW and under text custom field add details as "CMT-2.34.7 test field "
 # You will see that part "CMT-2" of text field value "CMT-2.34.7 test field" gets converted to hyperlink whereas if the version number does not contain any part of the issue it displays just fine
 # screenhot attached

h3. Expected Results

text in text custom field should represent as simple text field
h3. Actual Results

Text in text custom field gets converted into hyperlink if the version number contains some parts that resemble issue key of any project

The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Adding a space after the hyphen helps in resolving the issue
fields.summary: version numbers in text fields are shown as hyperlinks

fields.description:
Currently, in a JIRA ticket that has Issue Links - the default is to show the first 5 links followed by a "Show x more links..." which will expand the Issue Links display to show all links.
And a "Wiki Page" is always shown under "Show x more links..."

*Example:*
 !Issue_Links.png|thumbnail! 

A Jira system administrator can define the order in which linked issues are displayed in the Issue Links section on the 'view issue' page by editing the value of the jira.view.issue.links.sort.order property on Jira's [Advanced settings|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/configuring-advanced-settings-938847828.html] page.

However, the "jira.view.issue.links.sort.order" property can only accept the following individual field values: 'key', 'type', 'status', 'priority' and 'resolution'.

It would be nice if there was an option that could be chosen to show "wiki pages" on the top of the list.
fields.summary: Option to Show "Wiki Pages" at the top under the "Issue Links" section of a Jira Issue

fields.description:
For customers who have dozens (or more) of Jira Core mail servers defined, making any wide-scale changes to the email environment for example the OAuth integration, requires many hours of manual administration tasks, or a direct database edit, which is unsupported.

h3.Suggested solution:
Allow for a global mail handler setting, such as OAuth integration, so that mail server settings can be bulk changed when changing, for example, Microsoft Office 365 associated user account information.

h3.Notes:
* [Setting up OAuth 2.0 for Jira Core|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracore/setting-up-oauth-2-0-integration-1005784173.html]
fields.summary: As an Enterprise Jira Admin, I want to bulk change Jira Core mail server settings

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When using the unlicensed user functionality toward Confluence, as an unlicensed user, the articles list is not showing from the 'Find a solution box' if Confluence does not have Global Anonymous Access turned on.

!Selection_197.png|width=274,height=111!



Upon investigating, it appears Jira doesn’t trigger the sync within Confluence's user directory which therefore causes the user to be unable to search in KB articles unless manual sync is performed.
h3. Environment
 * Confluence 6.3.2
 * JSD 3.6.1
 * Jira 8.13.6

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Configure the Knowledge Base with [Serving customers with a knowledge base|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskserver036/serving-customers-with-a-knowledge-base-921471856.html].
 # Ensure [JIRA and Confluence Application link|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/guide-to-link-knowledge-base-to-jira-service-desk-for-unlicensed-user-816677228.html] is configured and using the same user base
 # Set up Confluence to not allow Global Anonymous Access
 # Create a customer account through JSD portal
 # Try to search for an article

h3. Expected Results
 # List of articles should be listed

h3. Actual Result
 # No articles shown

h3. Workaround
 * *Assigning* the customer account to JSD application access, allow the account to search for articles correctly. This, however will consume JSD license
 * *Revoking* the customer account to JSD application access, will continue to allow the account to search for articles correctly. (seems to be a workaround)
 [video|https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B7c2il3hFpA0Q3NsY01tbmswaFU/view?usp=sharing]

OR

[Set up in Confluence a Jira User Directory|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/connecting-to-crowd-or-jira-for-user-management-229838465.html]. This pulls in all the users (licensed and unlicensed), but since they don't belong to the groups in Confluence with Can Use permissions, then they don't count towards the Confluence license.
 When you set up the User Directory
 # put it in the last position so Crowd comes first for those users and data
 # make it Read Only
 # Set *Update group memberships when logging in* to Never or for newly added users only
fields.summary: Knowledge Base for unlicensed user not showing when Confluence does not have Anonymous Access

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Some customers are using message custom filed  introduced from JIRA Toolkit Plugin. However, if the default value of message custom filed contains bracket character, after adding comment, the comment editor will turn into invalid status instead of closing comment editor normally. 
 !JRASERVER-72403-reproduce.png|thumbnail!

See detail in Steps to Reproduce section.
 Except the above UI problem. A syntax error is noticed in console of development tool.
 !JRASERVER-72403-syntax-error.png|thumbnail!

The above problem happened in Chrome. Also, according to customer, the below problem may be happened to Firefox
 * Duplicated comments may be added.
 * The third filed tab may disappear.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install JIRA Toolkit Plugin
 # Create a custom filed of Message Custom Filed(for edit)
 # Associate the above custom filed to a screen
 # Edit the default value of above custom field to a value with bracket, for example, (abc)
 # Edit the screen , add a new tab(second), and put the custom field to the second tab(If the problem is not reproduced, add the third tab, and put the custom field into the third tab )
 # Create a ticket
 # Input some comment and click the *Add* button

h3. Expected Results

Input editor area will disappear and comment will be added to comment list(history) normally.
h3. Actual Results

Input editor area persist showing in an invalid status as below, though comment has been added to comment list.
 !JRASERVER-72403-reproduce.png|thumbnail! 
 The above problem happened in chrome.

According to customer, for firefox, duplicated comments may be added, or the filed tab may disappear.
h3. Workaround
 * remove bracket from default value of  Message Custom Filed.
 * diable Jira Toolkit Plugin in Manage apps.
fields.summary: Using bracket character in value of message custom filed will break comment editor

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When visiting Jira's Audit Logging page (Advanced Audit Logging in Jira 8.8+), Jira will by default load a list of audit log entries sorted chronologically descending. In particularly busy and active instances, these entries are unlikely to contain the records the administrator is looking for. Additionally, this requires an unnecessary lookup against the database for these audit log records, resulting in undesirable performance overhead. 

h3. Suggested Solution

Allow a configuration for, or otherwise change, the audit log page so that the page does not initially load a list of results upon visiting the page, until a search is requested.

h3. Workaround 
N/A
fields.summary: Allow Audit Log to not initially show results

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Remove/hide None option on the optional custom Radio button as per radio button basis.
Currently, the KB article [How to remove the "None" option from Radio Buttons|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-remove-the-none-option-from-radio-buttons-330795312.html] affects all radio buttons.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
When Radio button is optional, it will show None as the default option.  Customers would like to remove/hide None option on the radio button as per radio button basis and not all radio buttons.

h3. Expected Results
Remove/Hide None option on per radio button.

h3. Actual Results
The radio button will show None option when the radio button is optional.

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Remove/Hide None option on the optional Radio button

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Removing a checkbox during issue transition with a validator fails on save and duplicate the checkbox value.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new Checkboxes custom field and associate it to the Resolve transition screen.
 # Resolve Issue Screen contains Resolution and Checkboxes
 # Create an issue with Checkboxes value '1'
 # !Img1.png!
 # During the transition to Done, if we uncheck the Checkboxes value '1' and don't select the Resolution, it would fail as expected due to the Resolution validator, but it creates a new Checkbox '*1 (not available)*''

h3. Expected Results

The original option from the checkbox would be marked back.
h3. Actual Results

Creates a new Checkbox option with (not available)
 !Img2.png!
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Removing a checkbox during issue transition with a validator fails on save and duplicate value

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
For customers who are using Jira Service Management, after upgrading the Jira Core/Software, we don't see *Update* button to update Jira Service Management on *Versions & licenses* page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Upgrade the Jira Core/Software.
# Once upgrade is successful, please go to *Jira Administration* > *Applications* > *Versions & licenses* page.

h3. Expected Results
We should see the "Update" button to update the Jira Service Management to 'compatible version.

h3. Actual Results
We don't see "Update" button to update the JSM to a compatible version. Page will show the old version of JSM.
 !JSD upgrade Bug 1.png|thumbnail!  !JSD upgrade Bug 2.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround
{panel}
# Go to *Jira Administration* > *Applications* > *Versions & licenses* page.
# Take the backup of license present in *License key* for Jira Service Desk/Jira Service Management and delete it.
 !JSD Upgrade Bug workaround 1.png|thumbnail! 
# Once we delete the license, we will see "Update" button to the compatible version of Jira Service Desk/Jira Service Management.
 !JSD Upgrade Bug workaround 2.png|thumbnail! 
# Please click on "Update" button so that JSM update process is triggered.
 !JSD Upgrade Bug workaround 3.png|thumbnail! 
#  JSM will be updated to 'compatible version successfully. 
 !JSD Upgrade Bug workaround 4.png|thumbnail! 
# Once update is successful, please paste the license (from Step 2). The license will be updated and we can see the changes reflected successfully.
 !JSD Upgrade Bug workaround 5.png|thumbnail! {panel}

h3. Workaround 2
* Under *Jira Administration* > *Applications* > *Versions & licenses* page, uninstall the JSM application then re-install it again. Once done, it should be installed with the compatible version.
fields.summary: Update button is not displayed for Jira Service Management(Desk) after upgrading the Jira Software

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Non-admin users get common.forms.ajax.timeout error while trying to view a workflow which is shared among 7000 projects. Problem is related to additional permission check executed for Non-admin users.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a workflow
 # Use the same workflow among a very large number of projects ( 7000 for example )
 # Login as a non-admin user ( Project Lead )
 # Go to Project Settings > Workflows

h3. Expected Results

User should be able to view the workflow in a couple of seconds
h3. Actual Results

Below error message is displayed in the UI,
{noformat}
common.forms.ajax.timeout 
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

No workaround
fields.summary: Timeout  error "common.forms.ajax.timeout" while trying to view a shared workflow by non-Admin user

fields.description:
With the recently introduced feature [Anonymizing users|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/anonymizing-users-992677655.html] it's possible to anonymize (although I'd say it's pseudonymization) a user once they have left the company. While this is a great step, our legal team says that GDPR also demands taking care of the personal data of users that are still employed.

Our scenario: We have issues containing documentation that we don't want to delete. But, after a certain amount of time, the personal data in the issue (assignee, reporter, comments, issue history) becomes less relevant and we would agree to it being pseudonymized. That would mean only pseudonymizing the data of a single issue, not a whole user. Or maybe the data of a single user, restricted to a single issue (or rather a list of issues from a JQL result). 

Suggestion: Extend the [Anonymizing users|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/anonymizing-users-992677655.html] feature to allow pseudonymization of a single issue as described above. 

It would help me, if I could tell our legal team that an extension of this feature is on the roadmap. Would you kindly answer this question?

Thanks,
Steffen
fields.summary: Anonymizing / Pseudonymizing a single issue

fields.description:
The CardLayoutConfigTable component in Jira Server and Jira Data Center before version 8.5.15, and from version 8.6.0 before version 8.13.7, and from version 8.14.0 before 8.17.0 allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary HTML or JavaScript via a cross site scripting (XSS) vulnerability.

_*Affected versions:*_
 * versions < 8.5.15
 * 8.6.0 ≤ version <  8.13.7
 * 8.14.0 ≤ version < 8.17.0

_*Fixed versions:*_
 * 8.5.15
 * 8.13.7
 * 8.17.0

This vulnerability is attributed to Matteo Sebasta.
fields.summary: XSS in fieldID - CVE 2021-26079

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Unable to create a project with shared configuration in JSM/JSD if Jira Software is uninstalled.
 We get the error "Hmmm... We couldn't create your project due to an unknown error. Try refreshing the page and start again."
 It works good if Jira Software is installed.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Do a fresh installation of Jira Software and Jira Service Manager (JSD)
 # Create a sample project in JSM.
 # Create new project from menu Projects>> Create Project >> Create a project with shared configuration, choose your sample project, *that will work good*!
 # Uninstall Jira Software (leaving or not the configuration).
 # Create new project from menu Projects>> Create Project >> Create a project with shared configuration, choose your sample project, *that fails with the message* !
 # If you reinstall Jira Software that works good again.

h3. Expected Results

It should work good without Jira Software installed.
h3. Actual Results

It fails with the message "Hmmm... We couldn't create your project due to an unknown error. Try refreshing the page and start again."
h3. Workaround
 # Install or reinstall Jira Software.
 # Uninstall Jira Software, stop all Jira nodes due to caching, start all Jira nodes (this worked good in the Lab)
 # If using docker, replace the base image for JSM and redeploy. (data must be backup for safety)

The expected outcome is having this working on the fly without above actions.
fields.summary: Unable to create a project with shared configuration in JSM/JSD if JSW is uninstalled

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When accessing Jira on Mobile browsers, there are mainly two issues:
 * When clicking on an issue or any saved/favorite filter (e.g assigned to me), nothing happens and you need to refresh the page in order to access the issue/filter page.
 * Adding comments does not work. When inserting a comment and clicking on 'Add' nothing happens. Refreshing the page doesn't help as well since you'll simply lose the comment.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

This was reproduced using Jira DC 8.13.6 and Google Chrome browser.
 # Access Jira from a supported mobile browser, or use a desktop browser and switch to the Mobile view.
 # Click on any issue from a filter.
 # Try to add a comment.
 # Click on one of the saved filters (e.g Assigned to me, etc.)

h3. Expected Results
 * You should be able to open the issue page.
 * You should be able to add a comment.
 * You should be able to access the filters directly.

h3. Actual Results
 * The issue page does not open. You have to reload the page for it to work.
 * The comment is not added. When clicking on 'Add' nothing happens and refreshing the page will cause the comment to be lost.
 * The filter does not open. You have to reload the page for it to work.

[^Screen Recording 2021-05-06 at 16.26.30.mov]
h3. Workaround

The issue is not reproducible using the Jira mobile App for Android so you can use it instead of accessing Jira from the mobile browser.
fields.summary: Adding comments and accessing issues/filters not working as expected when using Jira on Mobile browsers

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

After upgrading Jira Software or Core to version 8.13 or higher, the installed JSM version isn't recognized as incompatible, and that it should be upgraded. 

UPM version doesn't seem to affect this. The problem has been observed with new UPM versions (after bundling) and persisted when downloading old UPM versions, from before the bundling. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install Jira Software and Jira Service Management in a version below 8.13
 # Apply data center license to both apps
 # Upgrade JSW to 8.13 or higher
 # Go to *Cog > Applications* and notice that JSM isn't recognized as incompatible 

h3. Expected Results

A message should be displayed on the Applications page saying that the current JSM version is incompatible and that it should be upgraded. 

 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

Jira won't inform that JSM needs to be upgraded, possibly leading to incompatibility between them.

 !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

 # Obtain the URL/link for the proper JSM version from the [JSM Version page|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1213632/jira-service-management/version-history]
 # Go to *Cog > Manage Apps > Manage Apps*
 # Click on Upload and paste the URL obtained from step 1 in the plugin URL
 # Wait for the upgrade to finish

No restart is required.
fields.summary: Upgraded JSW doesn't inform that installed JSM requires upgrade
Reusing a mysql database user on a new database caused Jira setup to fail with Database is not empty message

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Currently, when using JIT provided by [SSO for Atlassian Server and Data Center|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1216096/sso-for-atlassian-server-and-data-center?hosting=server&tab=overview], users are updated every time they log in.

This can cause group membership from being lost if the groups are being managed directly in Jira's internal directory.


h3. Environment
* Jira DC 8.15.x
* SAML SSO 4.1.5
* OIDC for SSO
* JIT enabled

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Login with a user for the first time in Jira, that is provided by the IDP;
# JIT will create the user in the internal directory as expected;
# Add Jira internal groups to the newly created user;
# Log out;
# Upon the next log-in, the Internal groups are removed and only the groups provided by the IDP with JIT will be kept.

h3. Expected Results
Just like the Delegated LDAP directory, internal groups should be kept and new groups provided by the IDP 

h3. Actual Results
Users are removed from internal groups as they log in.


h3.Workaround
Manage the groups on the IDP side, by creating groups with the same name as Jira's internal groups in the IDP, or disable JIT.
fields.summary: Local group membership is removed when JIT is enabled.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, Jira allows users to configure Outgoing and Incoming Mail Servers with a timeout value of 0.

Using such timeout value in Mail Server configuration means that Jira will try to connect indefinitely to mail servers. If for any reason the connection with the mail server is unstable, the following issues might happen:
- the Mail Queue Service will get stuck and Jira notifications will stop being sent, as explained in the KB article https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/jira-notifications-piling-up-in-the-mail-queue-due-to-smtp-server-infinite-timeout-setting-1031837054.html
- Or the Mail Server will get stuck and stop processing incoming mails, as per the KB article https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/jira-mail-handlers-get-intermittently-stuck-due-to-the-pop3-imap-server-infinite-timeout-setting-1063162672.html

h3. Suggested Solution

Do not allow Jira admins to use 0 as a timeout value when configuring any type of Mail Servers, due to the possible issues it can cause.
fields.summary: Prevent Jira admin users from setting a timeout value to 0 in Outgoing Mail and Incoming Mail Server configurations

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
REST API for Deleting actor users/groups returns success (204) even if the group/user doesn't exist in Jira. In the documentation for [JIRA 8.5.3|https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/REST/8.5.3/#api/2/project/{projectIdOrKey}/role-addActorUsers]
h3. Steps to Reproduce
Do a DELETE request to the endpoint /rest/api/2/project/{projectIdOrKey}/role/{roleId}?group={groupname} sending an invalid use like this groupname

Do a DELETE request to the endpoint /rest/api/2/project/{projectIdOrKey}/role/{roleId}?user={username} sending an invalid use like this username

h3. Expected Results
If the group indicated does not exist, the expectation is that there would be an error 404 as indicated in the documentation: "STATUS 404 Returned if the project or role is not found, the calling user does not have permission to view it or does not have permission to modify the actors in the project role".

h3. Actual Results
A message 204 (success) is returned.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: REST API for Delete actor groups/users returns success (204) even if the group doesn't exist

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
"Due Date" system field and all "Date Picker" type custom fields are recalculated to UTC in CSV export file. Both "CSV (All fields)" and "CSV (Current fields)" export methods are affected. All other export methods available on the Issue Search page are not affected (HTML and XML export). The problem can be reproduced only in Jira 8.16.0 and 8.16.1, all older versions (including 8.15.1) are not affected.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Edit Jira issue and set some date in the "Due Date" system field. Alternatively, you can set some date in any "Date Picker" type custom field.
 # Go to Search Issues page and enter JQL that will list issue from step 1 as one of the results.
 # Export the results using the "CSV (All fields)" or "CSV (Current fields)" method.
 # Look into an exported CSV file to verify exported data.

h3. Expected Results
Assuming that the date set in the "Due Date" system field or "Date Picker" custom field was 6th May 2021, the value in CSV export file should be: *06/May/21 12:00 AM*.

h3. Actual Results
Assuming, that Jira environment is configured for Sydney AEDT timezone (GMT+10), the actual result is: *05/May/21 2:00 PM*. 10 hours are subtracted from the correct date (06/May/21 12:00 AM), so the *time is recalculated from GMT+10 to UTC (GMT+0)*. Data stored in the database is the same across all impacted and not impacted Jira versions.

h3. Attached Files
 * Data from Jira 8.15.1 (date set in "Due Date" system field and "Test Date" date picker custom field was 6th May 2021):
 ** "[^Database_data_8151.txt]" - stored data is correct and the same as the one from Jira 8.16.1.
 ** "[^JIRA_8151_CSV_export.csv]" - *exported data is showing the proper values* in the "Due Date" system field and "Test Date" date picker custom field.
 * Data from Jira 8.16.1 (date set in "Due Date" system field and "Test Date" date picker custom field was 6th May 2021):
 ** "[^Database_data_8161.txt]" - stored data is correct and the same as the one from Jira 8.15.1.
 ** "[^JIRA_8161_CSV_export.csv]" - *exported data is showing the wrong (recalculated) values* in the "Due Date" system field and "Test Date" date picker custom field.

h3. Workaround
Custom fields using date time pickers are not affected by this (only date pickers). Using custom fields with date time pickers will export with the expected time.
fields.summary: Due Date system field and all Date Picker custom fields are recalculated to UTC during CSV export

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Today only Jira administrators can use the "Where's my field?" link. It would be useful for that to be available for other users as well.

h3. Suggested Solution
To make it so the "Where's my field?" link is available for regular users

h3. Why this is important
It can be helpful to users to be able to locate fields in the project. And since Jira admins can see it and regular users can't, it can lead Jira admins to provide wrong steps to users.
fields.summary: Make the "Where's my field?" availiable for more users

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira search doesn't work on a text field whose value is a single letter *A*.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a single line text field and add it to screens
 # Create an issue and type just the letter *A* in the field
 # Create an issue and type just the letter *B* in the field
 # Search for issues: {{"custom field" ~ B}}
 # Search for issues: {{"custom field" ~ A}}

h3. Expected Results

Jira would bring the issue when searched for *~ A* as it does with *~ B*.
h3. Actual Results

Results are empty when searched for *A* but it works when searched for *B*.
h3. Workaround
Available in the KB article [Searching for single words in text fields does not work in Jira|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Searching+for+single+words+in+text+fields+does+not+work+in+Jira]
fields.summary: Text custom fields filled with a single letter A aren't searchable

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
As of now, it is not possible to call the CREATE, EDIT issues REST API by specifying the User keys in the Reporter/Assignee fields.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Use this call to create issue > POST /rest/api/2/issue
 # Use the user_key in the field for Reporter/Assignee
"assignee": {
            "key": "JIRAUSER10000"
        }

"reporter":{"name":"JIRAUSER10000"}

h3. Expected Results
The issue gets created with the user with user_key JIRAUSER10000
h3. Actual Results
An error is thrown ""assignee": "expected Object containing a 'name' property""

For Reporter, > "reporter": "Reporter is required."`

h3. Workaround
The only option is to use the *name* property. But this is not GDPR friendly to use the usernames in all the REST API calls
fields.summary: For create issues, edit issues via REST APIs Jira accepts only usernames but not the userkeys

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

With Jira 8.14, personal access tokens can now be created as a means to access the REST API in Jira Server/Data Center. While these tokens are a useful authorization alternative to access the REST API, one limitation is that user-uploaded avatars are not accessible via these tokens.

*Currently:*
* The REST API endpoint at [/rest/api/2/user/avatars|https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/REST/8.16.0/#api/2/user-getAllAvatars] returns links to custom avatars:
{code}
    "custom": [
        {
            "id": "1010",
            "owner": "andrew",
            "isSystemAvatar": false,
            "isSelected": false,
            "isDeletable": true,
            "urls": {
                "16x16": "http://localhost:8090/jira/secure/useravatar?size=xsmall&avatarId=10080",
                "24x24": "http://localhost:8090/jira/secure/useravatar?size=small&avatarId=10080",
                "32x32": "http://localhost:8090/jira/secure/useravatar?size=medium&avatarId=10080",
                "48x48": "http://localhost:8090/jira/secure/useravatar?avatarId=10080"
            },
            "selected": false
        }
    ]
{code}
* However, if a personal access token is passed as authentication to those links, the request returns a 403. Using curl, we can see that the user is being redirected to a login page.

h3. Suggested Solution

* Create a REST API endpoint that can provide the binary data stream of custom avatars, enabling REST API users to download avatars using a personal access token, or
* Allow requests including personal access tokens to access data at {{/secure/useravatar}}, so that these requests can be made successfully without redirecting to a login page.

h3. Why this is important
 
This currently works with curl requests using basic authentication. Also, this appears to be possible in Jira Cloud using API tokens, so this is slightly out of parity with Cloud from a product standpoint.
fields.summary: I want to be able to download user uploaded avatars using personal access tokens

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When upgrading the plugin [*Email This Issue*|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/4977/email-this-issue] from version {{7.1.1.8}} to version {{8.1.3-GA}} or later, the same fails to create the table {{*dbo.AO_544E33_SMTP_CONNECTION*}}.
 This prevents users from accessing the plugin's functionalities.

According to the plugin's vendor, they've checked the plugin and found no issues on their side.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install [Email this Issue 7.1.1.8|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/download/apps/4977/version/1002280]
 # Go to *Administration > Manage Apps > Manage Apps*.
 # Find the plugin *Emails this Issue* then, click on the {{*Update*}} option.

h3. Expected Results

The plugin is updated successfully and is able to be used.
h3. Actual Results

The plugin beings to throw errors in the logs and is not usable.

The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-jira.log file:
{code:java}
active-objects-init-JiraTenantImpl{id='system'}-0 ERROR adminep     [n.java.ao.sql] Exception executing SQL update <ALTER TABLE dbo.AO_544E33_CONTEXT ADD CONSTRAINT fk_ao_544e33_context_smtp_connection_id FOREIGN KEY (SMTP_CONNECTION_ID) REFERENCES dbo.AO_544E33_SMTP_CONNECTION(ID)>
com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.SQLServerException: Foreign key 'fk_ao_544e33_context_smtp_connection_id' references invalid table 'dbo.AO_544E33_SMTP_CONNECTION'.
{code}
h3. Workaround

Instead of updating the plugin, uninstall the current version then install the new one.
fields.summary: Upgrade plugin fails to create ActiveObjects tables

It is possible to create an issue with a disabled value on a custom field, by setting the value directly on the URL.

 # Create a URL for the Create Issue screen, such as: {{_https://<JIRA_URL>/secure/CreateIssueDetails!init.jspa?pid=10043&issuetype=14&customfield_10121=12140_}}
 ## The id 12140 is the disabled value.
 # The issue will be created with the disabled value.

h3. Expected Results

It should not be possible to populate custom fields with disabled values.
h3. Actual Results

fields.description:
Epic with lots of issues (e.g: more than 5000 issues) takes long time to load.

Suggest limit of 100 issues at a time and have pagination to go through the list of issues associated to the same epic.
fields.summary: Pagination for 'Issues in epic' panel in issue view

fields.description:
Currently in Jira Insight, it is allowed to grant user permission on schema, or object level but not attribute level. When we want to set user edit permission for some of the attributes for an object but block edit permission for the rest, we will have to separated the attributes into two objects, and make one to be editable by users, and the other is editable by admin/manager/developer. It is very inconvenient for the users if they want to browse all attributes as they need to access two objects. 

We expect Jira Insight team to improve the permission function so we we can set different permission in attributes in the same object based on need. 

Hope Insight team will implement this feature shortly as this has already introduced lots of hard work for us to maintain data in Insight. 

 

Thanks.
fields.summary: JIRA Insight - grant permission on attribute level

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If we make multiple calls of {{POST /rest/api/2/project/<projectKey>/role/<roleId>}} simultaneously (i.e., in parallel), the permissions render incorrectly, as though multiple threads are accessing the same resource. This does *not* occur if the calls are made sequentially (i.e., chained).
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add ~20 users to a role in parallel via the REST API, e.g.,
{code:bash}
curl -D- -u admin:sphere -H "Content-Type: application/json" -X POST -d '{ "user" : ["user1"] }' -k http://10.125.91.25:8080/jira/rest/api/2/project/TES/role/10002 & curl -D- -u admin:sphere -H "Content-Type: application/json" -X POST -d '{ "user" : ["user2"] }' -k http://10.125.91.25:8080/jira/rest/api/2/project/TES/role/10002 &....{code}

h3. Expected Results

Each user should be added to the appropriate role.
h3. Actual Results

Not all users are added to the role. In the screenshot below, users 17 and 18 are missing, whereas user1-user20 were added: !Users assigned on the project role.png|width=570,height=422!

In the audit log, we see that identical parallel calls removed the same users, but added different ones:

!Audit log.png|width=553,height=245!

Note that *user17 (**JIRAUSER10116)* was missing in the permissions screenshot above.
h3. Workaround

Ensure that calls are made one at a time, rather than simultaneously.
fields.summary: Adding Users to Roles Via REST API Not Threadsafe

fields.description:
Request for Jira to use a centralized node for search Indexes, as in ElasticSearch.
Similar to what is available for Bitbucket Data Center:

[https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver075/use-an-elasticsearch-cluster-with-bitbucket-data-center-1018785752.html]

[https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/how-to-install-and-configure-a-remote-elasticsearch-instance-815577748.html]
fields.summary: Allow Jira to work with ElasticSearch

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Currently the admin/CurrentUsersList.jspa (titled *Current user sessions in Jira*) will show 50 entries at a time and it does not have a search, sort or export function making it lose value when you have hundreds of entries to go through.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Head to <$JIRA_BASE_URL>/secure/admin/CurrentUsersList.jspa

h3. Expected Results

Be able to sort, search and export the results.
h3. Actual Results

Unable to sort, search or export the results.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
 There's also no REST endpoint available to obtain this information.
fields.summary: Enhance CurrentUsersList.jspa with sort search and export functions
